meanings.definition: The lowest point in the fortunes of a person or organization.
meanings.sent1: After losing his job, he reached the nadir of his career.
meanings.sent2: The company's nadir was when they went bankrupt.
meanings.sent3: It was a comedy of errors that led to their nadir in the business world.
meanings.sent4: The team's defeat in the final game marked the nadir of their season.
meanings.sent5: The image of him sitting alone in the empty office symbolized the nadir of his professional life.

meanings.definition: The point on the celestial sphere directly below an observer.
meanings.sent1: Looking up at the stars, she wondered about the nadir beneath her.
meanings.sent2: The concept of nadir helps astronomers locate objects in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The idea of aliens living at Earth's nadir made for an interesting sci-fi story.
meanings.sent4: The moon's position at the nadir created a stunning visual effect.
meanings.sent5: Stargazers often use the nadir to understand the night sky better.
